availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Egbert T. Fish (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, court clerk)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Ann E. Wallace Fish on January 30, 1861. Father of Alza J. Fish and Louisa E. Fish. Clerk of the Rockcastle Circuit Court from 1858 to 1861. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mt. Vernon, p. 583; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 2; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mt. Vernon, p. 4; Jordan Dodd, Kentucky Marriages, 1802-1850, Rockcastle County, Kentucky, January 30, 1861; Thomas S. Page, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1859 (Frankfort, KY: John B. Major, 1860), p. 291; Grant Green, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861 (Frankfort, KY: John B. Major, 1862), p. 306; D. Howard Smith, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1870 (Frankfort, KY: S. I. M. Major, 1871), p 163; Find A Grave, "Egbert T Fish, Sr. (1827-1872)," Memorial #6123837, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=6123837 (accessed August 9, 2017).
